skill.name: literature-review
skill.description: Conduct comprehensive, systematic literature reviews using multiple academic databases (PubMed, arXiv, bioRxiv, Semantic Scholar, etc.). This skill should be used when conducting systematic literature reviews, meta-analyses, research synthesis, or comprehensive literature searches across biomedical, scientific, and technical domains. Creates professionally formatted markdown documents and PDFs with verified citations in multiple citation styles (APA, Nature, Vancouver, etc.).
skill.summary: Conduct comprehensive, systematic literature reviews using multiple academic databases (PubMed, arXi...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The scripts process user-provided files and call external DOI and CrossRef APIs for citation verification. They invoke local tools like pandoc and xelatex for PDF generation. No sensitive file access, environment harvesting, or data exfiltration patterns were found.

content.value_statement: You need a reproducible review process with accurate citations. This skill structures the workflow, verifies DOIs, and generates polished outputs.
actual_capabilities: Deduplicate search results by DOI or title from JSON inputs
Rank and filter results by citations or year
Verify DOIs via doi.org and CrossRef APIs
Generate APA or Nature formatted citations from metadata
Export search results to markdown or BibTeX
Create PDFs from markdown using pandoc and xelatex
limitations: Does not perform database searches directly
Requires network access for DOI verification
PDF output needs pandoc and a LaTeX engine installed
Citation styles depend on available CSL files

use_cases.title: Prepare a thesis review
use_cases.description: Aggregate papers, verify DOIs, and format a clean literature review for a thesis chapter.

use_cases.title: Audit search results
use_cases.description: Deduplicate and summarize multi-database exports for a systematic review team.

use_cases.title: Summarize a research area
use_cases.description: Rank papers by citations and produce a brief literature scan with verified references.

prompt_templates.title: Start a review
prompt_templates.scenario: Beginner needs a structured review plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a step by step plan for a systematic literature review on gene therapy for sickle cell disease, including search strategy and screening.

prompt_templates.title: Deduplicate results
prompt_templates.scenario: Intermediate user has a combined JSON export
prompt_templates.prompt: Process combined_results.json to deduplicate and output markdown with a brief summary of sources and year distribution.

prompt_templates.title: Verify citations
prompt_templates.scenario: Advanced user wants DOI checks and formatted refs
prompt_templates.prompt: Verify DOIs in my_review.md and generate APA formatted citations for the verified list.

prompt_templates.title: Generate PDF
prompt_templates.scenario: Expert user needs a publication ready PDF
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a PDF from my_review.md using Nature style citations with a table of contents and numbered sections.

output_examples.input: Verify citations in my_review.md and summarize the results.
output: Generated an APA reference list for verified entries
Saved a detailed citation report alongside the markdown file

best_practices: Document every database search string and date for reproducibility
Run DOI verification before finalizing the review
Use the template to keep sections consistent and complete
anti_patterns: Relying on a single database for comprehensive coverage
Summarizing studies one by one instead of synthesizing themes

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it is designed for those platforms and uses standard markdown workflows.

faq.question: What limits should I expect?
faq.answer: It does not search databases directly and depends on your exported JSON inputs.

faq.question: Can it integrate with other research tools?
faq.answer: Yes, it can consume exports from PubMed, arXiv, and other sources.

faq.question: Does it access or store sensitive data?
faq.answer: No, it only reads the files you provide and sends DOIs to public APIs.

faq.question: What if PDF generation fails?
faq.answer: Install pandoc and xelatex, then rerun with the check deps option.

faq.question: How does it compare to manual reviews?
faq.answer: It improves consistency and citation accuracy, but still requires expert judgment.
